div.p: German History in Documents and Images (GHDI) is the product of close cooperation between the editors and the GHI-based project team, whose members are introduced below.

div.head: Daniel Burckhardt
div.p: Technical developer Daniel Burckhardt designed the GHDI backend, integrated the search engine, implemented the presentation layer, and developed the TEI schema. At the GHI, Daniel works on German History Intersections and German History in Letters, as well as all other digital initiatives, including the annual digital history conference.

div.head: Katharina Hering
div.p: Digital project librarian Katharina (Katja) Hering is responsible for collection management (Collective Access), bilingual thesaurus development, and rights and reproduction research and administration. She also supports the GHDI editorial program through source research and other tasks. Katja also works on German History Intersections and German History in Letters and co-edits the digital history blog href.

div.head: Simone Lässig
div.p: Simone Lässig is the director of the GHI. She is a cultural and social historian of the nineteenth and twentieth centuries. Her research focusses the history of knowledge, migration, memory cultures and memory politics, digital history, and educational media.

div.head: Insa Kummer
div.p: Insa Kummer contributes to the overall editorial program of GHDI by researching, translating, editing, and proofreading sources. At the GHI, Insa is co-manager of German History Intersections and co-edits the Bulletin.

div.head: Elisabeth Mait
div.p: Research Associate Elisabeth Mait supports the GHDI project in many ways: by completing diverse research tasks, conducting metadata research, transcribing German script and Fraktur, and digitizing sources and preparing them for TEI markup. Elisabeth also works on German History Intersections.

div.head: Kelly McCullough
div.p: Kelly McCullough is the project leader of GHDI. She supports the project as a whole by overseeing contracts and outreach, and by translating, editing, and proofreading sources. Kelly also co-manages German History Intersection and is a co-editor of href.

div.head: Student Interns
div.p: The GHI project team is grateful for the assistance of the following student interns, who made especially significant contributions to GHDI:
